website_summaries.verdict: This camera is pricey, but it takes excellent photos and the tilting touchscreen helps make up for the lack of an electronic viewfinder.
pros: 20.8 MP camera that can take up to 20 frames per second
Easy to customize to suit your needs
Takes crisp, clear images in all light
cons: Unless you're serious about photography, you may not want to spend this much on a camera

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously portable, amazingly fun.
customer_reviews.text: Came from the Nikon 1 J3 for a few years. Love the new added features though the 15FPS at 4K is too low. To those familiar with the specs, this camera is a performer especially for its size. The only down point is that its stock battery overheats randomly while filming video (this is my primary use for this camera) which forces the camera to shutdown after the sensors trigger this danger. Looked into the forums and from time to time certain batteries had been recalled. Thank goodness I found two replacement batteries on Amazon. They work better (longer too as the cells hold more charge) and haven't seen any overheating issues.
customer_reviews.author: IMIAN

customer_reviews.title: 3 secs can be pretty short to time your movie
customer_reviews.text: Probably an OK camera for most uses / users. Here's the reason for the mediocre rating: We bought this to replace a broken Nikon 1 J1 camera whose standout feature is 400fps video. The J5 does the same thing, albeit only for 3 seconds (J1 did 5 seconds). If you're using the 400fps for forensics (we use it for impact tests) with manual shutter release, 3 secs can be pretty short to time your movie. Outside of the 400fps video this is pretty unremarkable camera; we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sepp Gabelberger

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest little camera, video camera, etc. I love it and am just beginning to enjoy. I'll be even happier when some manuals start coming out. I have the downloaded users guide and reference manual, and they are about as good as company products get. I'd recommend this camera to anyone looking for a small powerhouse.
customer_reviews.author: Rongeur in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera was exactly what I was looking for! It captures my eight month old in action. It is also great in low light! I am so happy to be able to capture my wiggly little boy in crisp amazing photos! It is also small enough to wear around my neck, stick in my purse or diaper bag! Love this camera!!! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great buy toldly worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur photographer and this camera is great for those just starting out and even those who have experience will love camera. It's very fast to focus and can effectively shoot at its advertised frame rate. The only thing some may not like is that is a really small camera. If you are used to a big DSLR like I was the transition feels strange. But this pays out in amazing portibility because it's so small. Highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Great camera system
customer_reviews.text: Great camera that takes incredible pictures (especially with prime lens) I recommend the 10 (closer shots) prime lens and the 18.5 (father away shots) and you have the perfect camera - WiFi connectivity is very convenient. Only drawback is the 4K recording is not really usable at the frame rate but this is a picture camera (not video).
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Lenses are very nice but limited
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it! Lenses are very nice but limited. One nice thing is you can use any lenses you have from your older DSLR cameras with the use of the F mount adapter. Takes excellent photos. If you do decide to get this, go with the one that includes the 30 to 110 mm lens as well if you can afford it. I found it was pretty difficult to find the 30 to 110 lens separately.
customer_reviews.author: eLeet

customer_reviews.title: pic quality is great, love raw photos easy to convert photos
customer_reviews.text: My first "real" camera. Still figuring it out, pic quality is great, love raw photos easy to convert photos. Still trying to figure out how to view sports burst in secession on my computer/wifi TV.
customer_reviews.author: davekara

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera. It is super easy to use. It is a great camera for moms! Just the fact that I am not a professional photographer, makes this camera great. I am able to take great pics with just a click. I also love the ability to take pictures and download them via my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mauk

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera when you do not want to lug your DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Just received this camera and already love the quality of the optics and picture . I shoot a Nikon D80 and wanted the portability of a smaller camera without trading off on the quality of shots. The 1 J5 takes amazing photos and I really love the 10-100mm lens. Nikon continues to produce "first in Class" products and this camera is no different. Just ordered a 18.5mm lens to supplement my collection.
customer_reviews.author: BadgerDan

customer_reviews.title: great camera for my online business photographs
customer_reviews.text: this is my second one! great camera for my online business photographs! easy to use and comfortable. very updated since my last, five years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Pickail

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I want it to, and with the FT1 adapter I can still use my older Nikon (and newer FX) glass. Nice camera.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mills

customer_reviews.title: Better than buying a new Telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: Very fun camera. What makes it fun? 1. The look. The black and silver retro styling, combined with the diminutive size makes people notice when your taking pictures of them. 2. The speed. Isn't it more fun driving a Ferrari than a Civic? 3. The touch screen. It's so natural these days to want to touch the screen, and Nikon did a good job. Very intuitive and works well. Bought the FT1 adaptor and using my Nikkor 18-200mm lens to get almost a 600mm zoom lens! Wish it had a view finder, but you can't have it all.
customer_reviews.author: Eckmando

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this camera! Was sceptical of switching from a standard DSLR to a mirrorless but my worries have been laid to rest for sure. Can't wait to receive my FT1 adapter to use my existing lenses.
customer_reviews.author: jayci

customer_reviews.title: I love how easy to use this camera is but how ...
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy to use this camera is but how quality the photos turn out in comparison to the average camera within this price point. The white outer case is very modern.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Amazing performance and can use all your Nikon glass
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera with a full feature set...Takes great pictures and lets you use all of your Nikon glass if you also get the FT-1 F mount adapter
customer_reviews.author: REJ

customer_reviews.title: Great light/small/capable camera
customer_reviews.text: I have D-90 Nikon DSLR, but I bought this package for my daughter, as she joined the yearbook creation team of her school. This is very light, very small, and very capable. So, she doesn't feel any burden to put this into her already heavy and overfilled backpack. This also shoots real fast without delay, so she can catch good scenes by snap shots. Picture quality is very good, too. I know that Sony A-6000 is very good and has view-finder, but it's larger/heavier/pricier than this, and doesn't fit to my and my daughter's purpose. I really like this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Seungho C.

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera !
customer_reviews.text: My husband never goes anywhere without this great little cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Karrys

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but...
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and portable but the line for lenses is super limited and discontinued so hard to find. It's a cool camera if you want something small but if you're looking for a mirrorless camera there are better options
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, even better features
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome camera with awesome features. All of the different artistic modes it comes with is perfect for taking great picture on the go. Its strap is great to wear and the camera is very durable. Took a picture of my boat on the beach with it and it got published in Boattests.com highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Pfeiff

customer_reviews.title: The Nikon 1 takes great photos and creates both
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon 1 takes great photos and creates both .jpg (or .tiff) and .nef (raw) files. I don't think it's a five star product, though, because the controls are so small, with correspondingly small lettering, that I found it difficult to use. It's easy enough to shoot snapshots, but for someone with less than excellent vision, setting up aperture priority or adjusting the exposure time in less than very bright sunlight is challenging. It's small size was convenient for travel, but ultimately was more challenging to use than I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Dallaspilot

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect camera for travel. It is compact and light weight. It easily fit into my sling backpack. I recommend getting extra batteries to keep charged and with you.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dumont

customer_reviews.title: Great size, picture quality not so great
customer_reviews.text: The pros of this camera are really in the compact size of the body and speed of the autofocus. In terms of picture quality, there is a lot of room for improvement in this camera. With the included zoom kit lens, I was not at all happy with the sharpness that I saw from the test pictures that I took. Low-light shooting even with high ISO was very disappointing. Overall, this is a good camera for the size but I'm afraid that I will have to look for a mirror less alternative with better image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kronky Jim

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera works very well and I have as much control as I need over the technology.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kweskin

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera. I'm not a pro
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I'm not a pro, but not quite an amateur. These new mirrorless cameras have so many features that higher end DSLR's have, at a much lower price point. Sure you don't get fancy gold or red trimmed lenses, no f-stops of 1.4, but if you want something to take quick family pics, or to take out and snap photos with your friends, then this camera fits the bill quite nicely. If you find yourself finding the limitations of this camera, then you have truly graduated and will need something with more lens choices, and a bigger flash.
customer_reviews.author: QA Tester

customer_reviews.title: Took great pics before that but doesn't seem to be reliable
customer_reviews.text: 4th day of use the lens won't work. Keep getting "Lens Error". Took great pics before that but doesn't seem to be reliable. Will be returning it tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: The j5 is a major improvement in picture quality over v1. Very fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: George A.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Small Camera
customer_reviews.text: Best small camera I've used. And, it has an interchangeable lens!!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Jantzen

customer_reviews.title: ... Nikon1 J3 with the J5 and have been very pleased with the new features and picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Nikon1 J3 with the J5 and have been very pleased with the new features and picture quality. Would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Excelent images and movies but you will spend more money ...
customer_reviews.text: Excelent images and movies but you will spend more money that you imagine. The lens are expensive and the one that comes isn't enough.
customer_reviews.author: gstrovao

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a long trip that I am going on because I wanted a camera that could take high quality photos but have a modest look that doesn't scream "look at me, I'm a tourist!". I am an not by any means a professional photographer, but this camera has allowed me to take beautiful, quality photos and it's small, compact size makes it easy to travel. I have included some photos I have taken so you can see the photo quality taken by an amateur photographer.
customer_reviews.author: caron.elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Semi Pro photographer finds it better than full size SLRs
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little camera. The pictures are astoundingly good. Far better than my D7000 with amazing clarity and resolution with the 10-30 kit lens. I'm planning to get the lens adapter to put my large lenses on this tiny body. My only disappointment is the camera does not do bracketing for HDR and instead does a fake HDR in camera. 1 star off for no exposure bracketing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Amazing good camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera for the price. Nice and sharp photos with the kit lens, Very good color, Very good focus system, Good high iso shooting for the price ISO 3200 Is very usable, Super nice back LCD screen better then all my other Nikon cameras. I will be using this as my everyday carry around camera when i am not using my larger DSLR cams on assignments and for when i need the super zoom range this offers. I am very happy with it. Only gave it 4 stars as the 4K video is not very usable as it is only 14 frames a second. And the Battery life is not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Small and Portable Mirrorless System
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon 1 J5 has met and exceeded some of my expectations. This camera made a journey to Colorado this fall and it performed well capturing the scenery and taking some portraits. It's small and lightweight so it was easy to carry in a back pack during hikes. Much smaller than other mirrorless cameras on the market and that came in handy. Only complaint was it does struggle in low light but that wasn't a surprise due to its specs. Highly recommend this camera for those wanting a super transportable easy to use mirrorless system.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: BEST of the J series
customer_reviews.text: I own J1, J3 & J4 and this J5 is da bomb! I adore the flip up screen and the video is spectacular. Now if only NIkon would release a camera case (white, please) and the ability to purchase Nikon (spare) batteries, I'd be SET. The 10/100 lens suits all I need in a camera for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Talk2USoon

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a hi quality image camera with a great zoom and weight light for family travel like Orlando ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hi quality image camera with a great zoom and weight light for family travel like Orlando Park's...and I get much more!!. It's really small & versatile....great job by Nikon.!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera! I already had the Nikon J2 and it was a great camera. I upgraded to this before my vacation and it is even better. My pictures and videos are amazing! The controls are easier to use than the prior versions of this camera. The pictures are clearer and sharper than the J2. I highly recommend this if you want your pictures to look like they were taken by a professional photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Shana A.

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 1 J5
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera. There is no doubt this has become an instant Nikon Legend! My previous entry level DSLR, the Nikon D40 awesome as well. The Nikon 1 J5 has every element, Video and so much more in such a compact camera. There are other functions that I still haven't use yet, but it is an awesome camera. The sharpness and details capture are excellent, from close ups to zooming. I recommend this to anyone looking for a good camera or anyone serious about pictures. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Montecasino

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Wanted to hug it, I loved it so much...lol takes great pictures. Easy to use. Great for beginner photographers who want to take a step above the point and shoots.
customer_reviews.author: N2ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love taking pictures with it for the first time
customer_reviews.text: Love taking pictures with it for the first time. For an amateur, I like the speed for taking pictures. I still have to explore the many features of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: dakota

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Work wonderful and definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Work wonderful and definitely worth the money. So many cool features and yet so simple to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Adams

customer_reviews.title: Video issues unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Small, great design and easy to carry. Picture taking and quality was good. We bought the camera for the versatility of being able to shoot HD video. However after about 12 mins the camera would overheat and shut down. This happened twice during my first video shoot during my daughters school play and it was repeatable under testing after. I read on-line that mirror less cameras have an video overheating issue, so this isn't isolated to the Ninon 1 J5. I've read that future generation cameras will fix this, but for our families needs we can't go with it under these conditions. We have returned the unit and will keep our eyes out for the next gen.
customer_reviews.author: P. Willis

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's been fun to learn about it. So small but awesome pictures.
customer_reviews.author: lincbode

customer_reviews.title: Good camera - may overheat
customer_reviews.text: Good camera for vlogging. I hitchhiked across the United States and canoed the east coast with this thing. Only issue is that if you plan to shoot for over 5-10 minutes it will overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Daley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, does exactly what it's supposed to do; take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good camera that could be better
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of nice features on the J5 over the J3—20 megs, big tilting monitor, PSAM on the dial, and small enough to carry all the time. But it is lacking: quick and dependable access to setting the ISO, easy access to manual focusing with my 10-100mm zoom, and a comprehensive manual that precisely shows the steps needed to take for all purposes (there are huge gaps in the J5 manual).
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Wardwell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It takes really good pictures even at night and the size of the camera it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Paulina Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera but to fragile, lens the same thing, fragile, takes greats pictures and it is very comfortable to handle.
customer_reviews.author: pedrollopez

customer_reviews.title: great buy!
customer_reviews.text: More than i could ask for, my wife loves this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Tolbert

customer_reviews.title: Please recommend for this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I wish to have the bag to come with to protect the body and lens. Please recommend for this gadget. I ordered MegaGear "Ultra light" too small, not fit for protection. I need to return it.,
customer_reviews.author: cchavalit

customer_reviews.title: The 10-100 zoom lens is incompatible
customer_reviews.text: In addition to casting shadow with 10-100 zoom lens the pictures are under exposed. The 10-100 lens is incompatible with Nikon 1 J5 and Nikon should not be selling this zoom lens with this camera Nikon 1 J5 as they are not compatible. Cannot believe this big blunder by reputable company like Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid M Malik MD

customer_reviews.title: Light scratches on the body and on the lenses but ...
customer_reviews.text: Light scratches on the body and on the lenses but none on the touch screen. Buttons work well, had some problems when I tried putting in the SD card though.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Took great video and pictures, loved the camera. However, I returned it for a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: John Ryan Bussell

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life and shutter speed are short (2 hours) and slow. It would be nice to have manual override for flash as system could not detect facial and light background cannot be over exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Camera Overheats Do NOT Buy If You Want To Shoot Video
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely ridiculous! The camera overheats and shuts down after about 15 mins of recording in 1080p30FPS mode, and that is in WINTER time, I imagine that in summer I will not be able to get even 5 minutes worth of video out of this thing. Also the application that you have to use to control the camera by wi-fi remote is absolutely TERRIBLE. I have seen first year college students develop better applications than this multi-billion dollar corporation, its an absolute disgrace.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Musatov

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: No complaint from performance perspective. I have big hands and it was cumbersome to handle it.
customer_reviews.author: K.J.

customer_reviews.title: No viewfinder, no deal...
customer_reviews.text: Could never get used to the lack of a viewfinder. Its basically a point and shoot camera with fancier settings, needed something with the capability of a full DSLR but small enough to take hiking with. Returned product
customer_reviews.author: Luvtris

customer_reviews.title: It's not that it didn't take good pictures but I felt like it was too small ...
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning the camera after a couple days. It's not that it didn't take good pictures but I felt like it was too small with regard to handling it. I was afraid I was going to drop it. I ended up buying a Sony A58 which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky S.

product_meta.title: Nikon 1 J5 Mirrorless Digital Camera w/ 10-30mm PD-ZOOM Lens (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver| Style:Body w/ 10-30mmFROM THE MANUFACTURER



The ultimate combination of image quality and portability, speed and versatility, creativity and connectivity. Shoot 20.8-megapixel photos, 1080/60p videos, time-lapse and slow-motion sequences, HDR (High Dynamic Range) images and much more with continuous shooting speeds faster than any DSLR on the market. With a 180 tilting touch screen, full manual control for those who want it, new onboard effects and even built-in Wi-Fi and Near Field Communication technology (NFC; NFC feature for Android v 4.0 or later smart devices only) for sharing your photos while on-the-go, the Nikon 1 J5 is the intersection of advanced technology, image quality and portability.


Meet the ultimate combination of image quality and portability, speed and versatility, creativity and connectivity: Nikon 1 J5. Masterfully designed on the inside and out, Nikon 1 J5 is faster than any DSLR on the market, achieves image quality and low-light performance few compact cameras can rival and yet is small enough to take on every outing. Shoot 20.8-megapixel photos, 1080/60p videos, time-lapse and slow-motion sequences, HDR (High Dynamic Range) images and much more. Pair it with any superb 1 NIKKOR lens, or add the optional FT-1 Mount Adapter and use legendary NIKKOR DSLR lenses. With a 180 tilting touch screen, full manual control for those who want it, new onboard effects and even built-in Wi-Fi and Near Field Communication** (NFC) for sharing your photos while on-the-go, Nikon 1 J5 is the intersection of advanced technology, image quality and portability.

**NFC feature for Android v 4.0 or later smart devices only

CAPTURE SIGHTS OTHER CAMERAS MISS
THE SPEED TO CATCH ALL OF LIFE'S MOMENTS
The Nikon 1 J5 achieves a level of speed and accuracy not even a DSLR can match. Its cutting-edge autofocus system uses 105 phase-detect AF points to instantly identify and focus on your subject. Hold down the shutter button and turn each second of action into 20 tack-sharp, full-resolution photos. Fix your focus, and the Nikon 1 J5 can capture at a mind boggling 60 frames per second continuously.* A new Sports Mode optimizes the Nikon 1 J5 for fast-action, so you can switch from shooting pre-game portraits to on-field close-ups without missing a play. 

*While photographs are being recorded to the memory card, the memory card access lamp will light. Depending on shooting conditions and memory card write speed, recording may continue for some time after shooting ends.

MARVEL AT THE IMAGE QUALITY
BEAUTIFUL PHOTOS AND VIDEOS IN ANY LIGHT
Capture in 20.8-megapixels of dazzling resolution. The Nikon 1 J5's all new back-side illuminated (BSI) CX-format CMOS image sensor gathers more light than a traditional CMOS sensor, enabling faster shutter speeds and enhanced low-light capabilities. Nikon's new EXPEED 5A image processing assures rich colors, smooth tones and razor-sharp details in every photo and Full HD video. And when the light is very low, shoot all the way up to ISO 12,800 with no fear of noise—High ISO Noise Reduction stacks four separate images for clean, sharp low-light results.

DREAM IT, CAPTURE IT
OUTSTANDING HANDLING AND CREATIVE CONTROL
The Nikon 1 J5 handles like a dream. Its 180 tilting touch screen lets you shoot from any angle that intrigues you and puts key controls—even the ability to fire the shutter—at your fingertips. You can quickly select an exposure mode, including full Manual control, from the dedicated PSAM dial, while the Command Dial makes it easy to navigate the Nikon 1 J5's intuitive menu system. You can even customize the Function button to recall your favorite menu or setting. Bring your creative vision to life.

SEND PHOTOS RIGHT TO YOUR SMART DEVICE
WITH NIKON'S BUILT-IN WI-FI AND NFC
Nikon snapbridge describes the experience of quickly and easily sending photos wirelessly from the Nikon 1 J5 to a compatible smartphone or tablet using built-in Wi-Fi and NFC. Once connected, you can use your compatible smartphone or tablet to share your Nikon 1 J5 photos while on the go and even control the Nikon 1 J5—see what the camera sees and take pictures!



SUPPLIED ACCESSORIES
 * Nikon-1-J5
 * EN-EL24 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery
 * MH-31 Battery Charger
 * UC-E20 USB Cable
 * AN-N1000 Strap
 * BF-N1000 Body Cap
 * User's Manual
 * Reference Manual CD
feature_bullets: Operating temperature:32 to 104°F (0 to 40°C).105 Phase-detection AutoFocus Points
20 frames per second continuous shooting with AF-C
1080/60p video capabilities and 180 degree tilting touch screen
EXPEED 5A advanced processing engine, picture Angle:Approx 27x lens focal length (Nikon CX format)
Built in WiFi and Near Field Communication (NFC)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars126 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
